hints.content: The  [[☃ definition 1]] is $7$, so each side length of the polygon was multiplied by $7$.

Let's look at an example of how this will affect a polygon.

Let's use a rectangle to represent Polygon $V$.  

Area of a rectangle is length, $l$, times width, $w$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/308d98f9098a5c367935c30175e0f0acaec732e0)

Area of Polygon $V=lw$
Now, we need to find the area of Polygon $W$.  Since Polygon $W$ was created with a scale factor of $7$, we need to multiply each side length in Polygon $V$ by $7$.

We need to multiply the new side  lengths to find the new area:

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/d578cc6980635e4500bdc73c6854db9caa68521f)

$\begin{align} A &= (l\times7)\times(w\times7) \\
\\
A&= l\times w\times7\times7 \\
\\
A&= lw \times {7}^2\\
\\
A&= lw \times {49} \end{align}$



Area of Polygon $W=lw\times49$

##Key idea  

The area of a polygon created with a scale factor of $x$ is $x^2$ times larger than the original polygon:

$\text{scale factor}^2=\text{how many times larger area of scale copy is}$
The area of Polygon $W$ is $49$ times the area of Polygon $V$.

Area of Polygon $V \times 49=$ Area of Polygon $W$

$1\times49=49$
The area of Polygon $W$ is $49$ square units.

question.content:

**What is the area of Polygon $W$?**
